body:
> Why is this not having Travis check?

looks like it was just slow and took a while to kick off... [it meanwhile did, and is green](https://travis-ci.org/github/apache/fineract/builds/668078887?utm_source=github_status&utm_medium=notification), so I've "self merged" this, based on your LGTM.

@vorburger sure would love to! I will go ahead and close this pull request and get to updating the wiki in the next couple of days. I have joined the confluence platform but can't see the edit button for the wiki page. Mind pointing me to how I can edit the page? Thanks.

> I have joined the confluence platform but can't see the edit button for the wiki page. Mind pointing me to how I can edit the page?

@Ezmerald we need to grant you Edit permission. I just tried, but cannot find a user named "Ezmerald" on https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/ to let you edit https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/FINERACT/Fineract-platform+Installation+on+Windows ... under what name did you register?
@vorburger the username I used is mhammoud.sara

> @vorburger the username I used is mhammoud.sara

@Ezmerald retry it now, I've granted you some permission which hopefully lets you edit the Wiki.

@vorburger I found a similar plugin for IntelliJ IDEA, should I add the same in the readme? 
please refer: https://plugins.jetbrains.com/plugin/1065-checkstyle-idea

Yeah sure go ahead and raise a PR to add that, seems like a great idea and
will be useful for others.

Hello @vorburger 

Can you review my PR and correct it

@DBryzz hello, can you please change the commit messege? It is recommended that the commit messege starts with issue number ðŸ˜ƒ 

Edit: The build is failing, you can run 
.`/gradlew clean build`
 to ensure the build passes locally.
hello @xurror, the build is failing integration tests can you please check it?

Yeah, it can't be helped. The failed tests do not relate to the changes I have made in this PR. I tried running the tests locally and even on branch develop and they keep failing.

These failures look slot like those caused by the flaky integration tests I reported before. 
I thought they were resolved. Not sure why it's happening again
I can at least confirm that the kubernetes deployment worked fine on pc though the tests are failing

@vorburger I checked and think I can edit the pictures. I have exams this week so will look into it this weekend/early next week and let you know what I did or if I face any problems. Wish me luck on my exams :)
Also, 2 commit messages for 1 PR does not look good in the commit history. So i suggests you squash your commit messages into a single message and don't forget to apply @thesmallstar comment.
It passes now. Not sure why it failed before.

@vorburger , @Anh3h , @conradsp , Please review and provide feedback on this given your  Docker related contributions on Fineract.
Good work @xurror , to make this usable and to pass Travis Test

Thanks for your comments
I will work on them


On Wed, Apr 1, 2020 at 12:08 PM Yemdjih Kaze Nasser <
notifications@github.com> wrote:

> Also, 2 commit messages for 1 PR does not look good in the commit history.
> So i suggests you squash your commit messages into a single message and

@vorburger the build is failing due to checkstyle issues, I hope you don't mind if I fix them and make a PR.

@vorburger ...one of Mifos Outreachy Applicant sending her first PR. CC @edcable

Thanks for your contributions @nnatarajan . This will be reviewed  and merged or feedback provided withing the next 48 hours. We hope you stay with us and keep learning and making contributions on Apache Fineract and Mifos.
This loos like pushed away due to COVID-19, I would like to finish the functional testing and one member is helping me finishing the integration test.

> @rrpawar96 any specific reason for using System.out.print() instead of a logger?

Not really, but it is used because till now all test cases scripts has used  System.out.print() instead of a logger and also it helps for quick debugging, so used it.

@rrpawar96 hello, I suggest you use logger, use of System.out would lead to checkstyle error after #733 is merged.
-thanks
Thank you, @awasum! That is very kind of you! Let me know if I need to make any changes to this one or to other PR - FINERACT-538.

@vorburger when I reopened the fineract folder in visual studio and  Git Bash to run the commands, I did as we discussed above and ran the gradlew.bat file then cd into fineract-provider and ran "gradle clean dist" and got "gradle: command not found". I had to go into the variables section of my environment section and add path "C:\gradle-2.10\bin". When I ran "gradle clean dist" again it built successfully. I am assuming that last time when I ran gradlew.bat the built was successful because the project was already open in my laptop and I executed the command after I had a successful build with the changes I had made.

gradle != ./gradlew

>

@vorburger hey , I was able to get some of the tests contributed by one of the GSOC aspirant, maybe down the day we would test the functionality. Could you help speed this up so that we can merge it quickly.

@rrpawar96 this still seems to have build failures, did you notice? The build logs on Travis CI are not accessible right now (it says "There was an error while trying to fetch the log."), probably due to https://www.traviscistatus.com showing that Travis CI is currently undergoing some maintenance... will you check out later (tomorrow) what the failures are, and fix? Then we can re-review and hopefully soon merge this. Also, once this is all good, the commits should probably be "squashed" into a single commit.

Yes @vorburger, I have fixed all the CheckStyle and SpotBugs issues, now the Travis build is failing in Integration test. (3 failed test cases are: ClientLoanIntegrationTest.testLoanCharges_DISBURSEMENT_FEE
ClientLoanIntegrationTest.testLoanCharges_INSTALMENT_FEE
ClientLoanIntegrationTest.testLoanCharges_SPECIFIED_DUE_DATE_FEE) and failed with the cause: totalLoan paramter is unsupported.

Taking into consideration the review by @Anh3h and @vorburger , I took upon myself to implement the configMap in this PR so we don't have to mount directories anymore. Also I've tried to mimic what has been done with fineract-cn-docker-compose by implementing scripts and also adapting the readme to be run first on kubernetes(GKE) and alternatively on minikube for those who want to test it locally.

So @Anh3h, if you still have the time, can you try this online?

> This looks good. I think it would also be good if issues can be created for the lacking tests on jira so that willing contributors can lend a hand to implement them

Do that, please

@awasum yes on it.
-thanks
Please, rebase and squash these commits @itzamnamx . Also fix the conflict resulting from another merge now affecting this PR. Thanks.
Status on this?
@percyashu or @xurror ..Please can we look into this?
@percyashu or @xurror ..Please can we look into this?
Sure

> We also need someone to actually try this out (follow this README, confirm it works).. any volunteers?

I've just tested this myself, and can confirm that it works as advertised! I'll merge this. @xurror great job!!!
@maektwain this PR now has merge conflicts which need to be manually resolve with a rebase...

@rrpawar96 what you need to do is figure out if these integration test failures are due to the changes in this PR, or arbitrarily failing tests... does running `./gradlew clean integrationTest` work for you locally? If no, figure out how to fix it locally. If yes, and based on https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/FINERACT-708?jql=text%20~%20%22ClientLoanIntegrationTest%22 it would look like these may just "flaky". In that case, do a rebase, and see if a new build passes. If not, wait a day, close and re-open the issue, and see if it's better.
Why did you send this as a draft? @percyashu ?

From what I read [here](https://github.com/rest-assured/rest-assured/issues/1175#issuecomment-499593018), with java8 we can only use atmost version 3.3.0 of restassured. So far this is an upgrade but to upgrade to the latest version, we first need to upgrade to java9 or higher. Well that's my opinion.

@awasum, do you buy this idea?
This is now passing? What did we fix?

> From what I read [here](https://github.com/rest-assured/rest-assured/issues/1175#issuecomment-499593018), with java8 we can only use atmost version 3.3.0 of restassured. So far this is an upgrade but to upgrade to the latest version, we first need to upgrade to java9 or higher. Well that's my opinion.
> 
> @awasum, do you buy this idea?

Do it. Did u already add the fix?

> This is now passing? What did we fix?

I suspect that it's "flaky" - passes sometimes, but fails. The question is if with the rest-assured upgrade Integration Tests fails a lot more often than they used to before the upgrade, or if that was a total coincidence...

Given that we have it passing how, I would say why don't we merge this? If we suddenly see ITs are failing a lot more often, we could always revert this.

>> @awasum, do you buy this idea?
> Do it. Did u already add the fix?

Note [FINERACT-846](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/FINERACT-846) re. Java 11; I would to do that separately than this PR.

> > This is now passing? What did we fix?
> 
> I suspect that it's "flaky" - passes sometimes, but fails. The question is if with the rest-assured upgrade Integration Tests fails a lot more often than they used to before the upgrade, or if that was a total coincidence...
> 
> Given that we have it passing how, I would say why don't we merge this? If we suddenly see ITs are failing a lot more often, we could always revert this.
> 
> > > @awasum, do you buy this idea?
> > > Do it. Did u already add the fix?
> 
> Note [FINERACT-846](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/FINERACT-846) re. Java 11; I would to do that separately than this PR.

Seems @xurror  forced pushed this 3 hours ago: https://github.com/apache/fineract/pull/719/commits/627c7032565d31aa5eb6d75eac4f35a1c6310319, why the thing passed.
Lets merged this....Now...
@awasum fixed a part of it, will be done soon :)

@vorburger , Thankyou for ur feedback and as I followed it and found out that the cause for failing  test cases of previous commit was this PR, so I fixed it and rebased the code and locally tested it. So locally the all integration test build got passed so after pushing it, now on Travis unfortunately, FixedDepositTest got failed.
@vorburger , should I squash all the commits and try again by running on Travis ?

Yeah, give it a try...

>

> > From what I read [here](https://github.com/rest-assured/rest-assured/issues/1175#issuecomment-499593018), with java8 we can only use atmost version 3.3.0 of restassured. So far this is an upgrade but to upgrade to the latest version, we first need to upgrade to java9 or higher. Well that's my opinion.
> > @awasum, do you buy this idea?
> 
> Do it. Did u already add the fix?

yes
Just a quick reminder. In my last push, I just regressed io.restassured to an older more compatible version.

@percyashu I guess the IT failures here are unrelated to this change, see [FINERACT-885](https://jira.apache.org/jira/browse/FINERACT-885). Just keep trying once a day or so, until we have a green build? I know it's stupid.. if you can dig more into FINERACT-885, perhaps try fixing [FINERACT-723](https://jira.apache.org/jira/browse/FINERACT-723), that would be cool! 

> I also want to check if very tenant is guaranteed to always have a TZ.
> @vorburger seems it falls dependent on the OS / JVM TZ if tenant TZ is null.

if it's not mandatory (`NON NULL`) in the DB, then you can't be sure, right? It would break backwards compatibility for any existing installations out there, agreed? The only thing we (you) could do if you want to fix this is to make a Flyway migration script that sets it to required? Then anyone upgrading would fail, and would be forced to set a TZ for each of their Tenants, if they don't already have one. Then you could make this code assume there always is one, and throw a (clear... include reference to a JIRA!) exception.

FTR the current build failure is definitely due to a flaky IT, see [FINERACT-887](https://jira.apache.org/jira/browse/FINERACT-887).. just (squash and) keep closing and re-opening this PR.

PS: @rahulg963 any future contributions to fix these "flaky" ITs would be very, very, welcome; see [FINERACT-850](https://jira.apache.org/jira/browse/FINERACT-850)!

Greetings

Thanks for your review and comments @vorburger. I will try to find out why CORS is the only violation findsecbug detects.

Regarding the Overly permissive CORS policy, I located the file and the violation is due to the line response.setHeader("Access-Control-Allow-Origin", "*"); in class org.apache.fineract.infrastructure.security.filter.TenantAwareTenantIdentifierFilter

"*"  needs to be replaced by a particular domain. I'll be happy if I someone could help me with the domain.

Thanks
==> https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/FINERACT-762 (incl. https://github.com/apache/fineract/pull/757)
In addition to https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/FINERACT-762, see also future https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/FINERACT-889 for more background about this.
PR failed due to SchedulerJobsTest > testSchedulerJob (see https://jira.apache.org/jira/browse/FINERACT-852) ... let's close and re-open tomorrow to see if a new build goes through.

> If the suggestions look good, I will make those changes for the build to pass :)

Sure, go for it!

I'm wondering how, once the build passes, we'll most efficiently review this PR... several of us having a look? Just "trust" you, once all tests pass, that this PR is just reformatting without any functional changing? That's probably OK, for a change like this...
Checkstyle probably was not scanning the entire code base, It started showing another 1529 files that need to be fixed :P, this PR has a long way to go I guess :)

> FTR the current build failure is definitely due to a flaky IT, see [FINERACT-887](https://jira.apache.org/jira/browse/FINERACT-887).. just (squash and) keep closing and re-opening this PR.

Yes, now code has been again rebased and squashed all the commits into one, now will try to pass the PR by closing and re-opening it.

May be this particular check (LineLength) is one to tackle later - I would try to first identify those which you can enable with the least effort (so those that either have few, or many but easily fixable by IDE automation).

@thesmallstar this seems to include an (arbitrary?) number of "break lines up" changes - was that intentional? It would perhaps be clearer both for me to review and for you to do if in each PR you only include the changes strictly required to make the respective module (here `EmptyStatement`) pass? Just a thought.
@vorburger, agreed on your point,making changes.
This failed due to what #764 will fix (work around, deactivating test); let's rebase this once that is in.
This failed due to what #764 will fixed (work around, deactivating test); let's rebase this once that is in.
This failed due to what #764 will fix (work around, deactivating test..); let's rebase this once that is in.
This failed due to what #762 will fix (work around, deactivating test); let's rebase this once that is in.

This failed due to what #762 will fix (work around, deactivating test); let's rebase this once that is in.

@xurror you're probably interested in this change, see my comment in FINERACT-881.

@awasum what's your view re. just ignoring a test? 

Ideally we should fix it, of course, but in the meantime... merge this?
Not sure why integration tests failed, probably due to other PR? If not, I will give a detailed look tomorrow.
This is still failing

> @awasum what's your view re. just ignoring a test?
> 
> Ideally we should fix it, of course, but in the meantime... merge this?

Ideally someone more familiar with the code should help us fix this. @Nayan , @nazeer1100126 , @vishwasbabu , @avikganguly01 . Help with resolving a flaky test as seen here: https://github.com/apache/fineract/pull/756 so that we dont comment this out. If we cannot find anyone to help fix this, we may ignore the test by this weekend. Is that too far? Once we ignore this, we may forget that we did like in the other ignored test for data import and others.
Hello @vorburger I did a quick rebase from develop branch to FINERACT-38 , let me know if this solves the conflict.
Let's actually not merge this one until we have #764 merged and see if that (alone) helps...
@fynmanoj re. build failure, please subscribe to and watch (or help fix??) #764 for [FINERACT-852](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/FINERACT-852)...
@thesmallstar re. build failure, please subscribe to and watch (or help fix??) #764 and #761 for [FINERACT-852](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/FINERACT-852)...

@thesmallstar re. build failure, please subscribe to and watch (or help fix??) #764 and #761 for [FINERACT-852](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/FINERACT-852)...
@vorburger will make changes.

@percyashu re. build failure, please subscribe to and watch (or help fix??) #764 and #761 for [FINERACT-852](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/FINERACT-852)... that's a mess, and help would be most welcome, see recent thread on the mailing list.
https://github.com/apache/fineract/pull/764 has being merged. lets run this or rebase with develop and see.

#764 has been merged. lets run this or rebase with develop and see.

#764 has been merged. lets run this or rebase with develop and see.
@vorburger Nopes , it does not show me any conflict issues , quite strange. About the generics I have removed them.

Oops, I know what is the issue, I took me while to realise the I was rebasing my own repo so actually this was happening 
Apache Fineract -- My Repo -- all the while I was pulling only My Repo.
This is now passing. Do you want to merge this @vorburger ?
I think, there are many commits now. This will solve all of the issue now.
@vorburger, and finally build got passed by Travis. ðŸ˜Š
Pretty strange all tests were passing now it shows integration tests are failing.

Have done functional testing also I was able to move and close the accounting closure. Seems to be working fine. 

There is a problem though with SQL Group by query which failed in 5.7 , I fixed it by setting it off , though this is not the bets route to do it.

```
Expression #1 of SELECT list is not in GROUP BY clause and contains nonaggregated column
```
